hgr::Node Class Reference
[Hierarchical graphics library]

#include <Node.h>

Inheritance diagram for hgr::Node:

[legend]
List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base class for all objects in scene graph.

Node contains model transformation and object hierarchy information. Note that even though nodes are reference counted, references to parent are weak, i.e. parent can be destroyed even though child is still referenced by the user. In that case the child is automatically unlinked from the parent.


Public Types

enum  NodeClassId {
  NODE_OTHER = (0<<4), NODE_CAMERA = (1<<4), NODE_LIGHT = (2<<4), NODE_VISUAL = (3<<4),
  NODE_SCENE = (4<<4)
}
enum  NodeFlags {
  NODE_ENABLED = 1, NODE_RENDERABLE = 2, NODE_LIGHTTYPE = (3<<2), NODE_LIGHTTYPE_SHIFT = 2,
  NODE_CLASS = (15<<4), NODE_BOUNDWORLDSPACE = (1<<8), NODE_DEFAULTS = NODE_ENABLED + NODE_OTHER
}

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum hgr::Node::NodeClassId
 

Enumeration values:
NODE_OTHER  Node is either plain node or unknown derived class.

Default type.

NODE_CAMERA  Node is Camera.
NODE_LIGHT  Node is Light.
NODE_VISUAL  Node is Visual.
NODE_SCENE  Node is Scene.

enum hgr::Node::NodeFlags
 

Enumeration values:
NODE_ENABLED  Node enabled flag.

Exact usage semantics is dependent on derived class.

NODE_RENDERABLE  Node renderable flag.

Exact usage semantics is dependent on derived class.

NODE_LIGHTTYPE  Set only for Light class instances.
NODE_LIGHTTYPE_SHIFT  Shift needed to access light type.
NODE_CLASS  NodeClassId of this Node.

Default is NODE_OTHER.

NODE_BOUNDWORLDSPACE  Set if Node's bounding volumes are stored in world space coordinates.
NODE_DEFAULTS  Default type flags for Node.

Creates non-parented node with identity as model transformation.

Member Function Documentation

int hgr::Node::depth (   )  const
 

Returns depth of the hierarchy at specified node.

If the node has no parent then the depth if 0, if single parent then depth is 1, etc.

Node* hgr::Node::findNodeByName (  const lang::String &  name  )  const
 

Tries to find node recursively with specified name from the node hierarchy.

Returns:
0 if node not found.

Returns the first child of this node.

Returns 0 if no children.

Returns cached (model-to-world) transform.

Can be used only during rendering.

Returns true if this node has the other node as some grand parent.

Links this as a child to parent node.

Increments reference counts of both nodes.

const lang::String& hgr::Node::name (   )  const
 

Returns name of this node.

Node* hgr::Node::next (   )  const
 

Iterates through the scene graph hierarchy.

This function can be used to enumerate all objects in the scene graph. Iteration is performed in child-first-then-sibling order. Note that to iterate throught the scene graph the return value of this function must be used to ask for next node.

Node* hgr::Node::parent (   )  const
 

Returns the parent of this node.

Returns 0 if no parent set.

math::float3 hgr::Node::position (   )  const
 

Returns current position in parent space.

Rotation can have scaling.
